Content:: The Sinhala Maha Sabha (Sinhala: සිංහල මහා සභා) was a political party in Ceylon, founded by Solomon West Ridgeway Dias Bandaranaike in 1934–5, in order to promote Sinhalese Buddhist culture and community interests. It backed the United National Party from 1946; and left the coalition in 1951 to form the Sri Lanka Freedom Party.  This article about a Sri Lankan political party is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it.
